segments.text: Have you moved into your new house yet , Michael ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We just moved in yesterday , actually .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , what do you think about the place ? Are you glad that you moved in ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's great ! Unfortunately , we're going to spend a fortune doing everything up .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How old is the house then ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's about 200 years old . It has a lot of history !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sounds fascinating . Where is your new house located ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's just off of the ring road .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you have a big yard ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's bigger than our last one . I've got flowers in the front , and fruits , vegetables and a fish pond in the back .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , yes . Our windows let plenty of natural light in . They've also got wonderful views of the park behind our house .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How many rooms does your house have ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Right now , there are three bedrooms , two barrooms , a kitchen , a sitting room , a dining room , and a living room . We're hoping to add on a green room and a guest bedroom . In fact , when the guest bedroom is ready , you should come and stay with us for a weekend .
segments.speaker: S2
